title: A brief account of a tour through some parts of Scotland
author: Hunter, Robert
snippet: The Castle stands at the top, and the Palace of Holyrood house at the bottom. St. Giles' Church, Avhich contains three places of Avorship : — the Parliament house and buildings connected with it, the Advocates' Library, and County Buildings, are on the left in going up towards the Castle. The Church is the most conspicuous object, and gives the street a noble appearance.
